IGPUBuffer

Defines the public interface to a buffer used by the GPU. When clients need to pass data to a compute shader (i.e. as either a StructuredBuffer, RWStructuredBuffer, AppendStructuredBuffer, or RWByteAddressBuffer) they will pass one of these objects via IShader::SetCSParam().

Module

import Rendering.Caustic.IShader;

Functions
CopyFromCPU
virtual void CopyFromCPU(
IRenderer* pRenderer,
uint8* pData
) = 0

CopyFromCPU() is used to move data from the CPU (i.e. client data) to the underlying GPU buffer.

Parameters
pRenderer
IRenderer*

renderer

pData
uint8*

pointer to buffer owned by client that contains the data

CreateGPUBuffer
CRefObj<IGPUBuffer> CreateGPUBuffer(
IRenderer* pRenderer,
EBufferType type,
uint32 numElems,
uint32 elemSize,
uint32 bindFlags
)

Creates a buffer on the GPU

Parameters
pRenderer
IRenderer*

renderer

type
EBufferType

which type of buffer we are creating (Structured, RWStructured, etc)

numElems
uint32

number of elements in buffer

elemSize
uint32

size in bytes of each element (on CPU without unalignment)

bindFlags
uint32

additional bind flags
